Target: OntoDevice is an ontology for describing devices, their capabilities and properties.

Comment: An object designed and manufactured to perform one or more functions.
Label: Device

Comment: A microcontroller is an integrated circuit (IC) designed to handle a specific task in embedded systems.
Label: MicroController

Comment: A portable telephone that can make and receive calls over a radio frequency link.
Label: Mobile phone

Comment: A portable computer device that combines mobile telephone and computing functions into one unit.
Label: Smart phone

Comment: A transducer that converts sound into an electrical signal.
Label: Microphone

Comment: An optical instrument that can capture an image.
Label: Camera

Comment: A device used within Earth’s planetary atmosphere to determine its precise geographical location.
Label: GPS device

Comment: A tag that uses a form of electronic identification technology (Bluetooth, RFID etc).
Label: Electronic tag

Comment: An electronic tag that exchanges data with a RFID reader through radio waves.
Label: RFID tag

Comment: A passive RFID tag that functions via the electromagnetic energy that gets transmitted from the RFID reader.
Label: Passive RFID tag

Comment: An active RFID tag that requires batteries for operation.
Label: Active RFID tag

Comment: A device for measuring the flow of oil.
Label: Oil meter

Comment: A device for measuring air quality.
Label: Pollution meter

Comment: A device that measure and communicate water usage from consumer to provider to facilitate water management and proper billing.
Label: Water meter

Comment: A device that measures magnetic field or magnetic dipole moment.
Label: Magnetometer

Comment: A tool that measures proper acceleration.
Label: Accelerometer

Comment: A device that measures the amount of electric energy consumed by a residence, a business, or an electrically powered device.
Label: Electricity meter

Comment: A sensor that detect minute localized changes in the force of Earth’s gravity caused by variations in rock or other materials’ density underground.
Label: Gravity sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the concentration of carbon dioxide gas in the atmosphere.
Label: CO2 sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the level of illuminance.
Label: Illuminance sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the level of humidity in the atmosphere.
Label: Humidity sensor

Comment: A sensor used to gather information from an RFID tag, which is used to track individual objects.
Label: RFID sensor

Comment: A device that is composed of one or more Sensors together with a MicroController.
Label: Smart sensor

Comment: A device that is usually used for the preservation of items like food via temperature regulation.
Label: Fridge

Comment: The desired or target value for an essential variable, or process value (PV) of a control system.
Label: Setpoint

Comment: The current state of something on whether it is inside or outside of a space or object.
Label: In out state

Comment: The ratio of working power, measured in kilowatts (kW), to apparent power, measured in kilovolt amperes (kVA).
Label: Power factor

Comment: The brightness of the screen of a device measured as a ratio.
Label: Screen brightness

Comment: A sound, especially one that is loud or unpleasant or that causes disturbance.
Label: Noise

Comment: A relationship between a device and the state that it is observing.
Label: observes

Comment: A relationship between a device and a quantity that it is measuring.
Label: measures

Comment: A relationship between a device and its length.
Label: has length

Comment: A relationship between a device and its height.
Label: has height

Comment: A relationship between a device and its width.
Label: has width

Comment: A relationship between a device and its price.
Label: has price

Comment: A relationship between a device and its mass.
Label: has mass

Comment: A relationship between a device and its system capability.
Label: has system capability

Comment: A relationship between a device and its operating range.
Label: has operating range

Comment: A relationship between a device and its survival range.
Label: has survival range

Comment: A relationship between a device and a setpoint.
Label: has setpoint

Comment: A relationship between a setpoint or operating property and the quantity it represents.
Label: has quantity

Comment: A relationship between a setpoint or operating property and the quantity it represents.
Label: has quantity

Comment: A relationship that describes a device being attached to another physical element or object.
Label: is attached to

Comment: A relationship that describes a device being connected to another device where the operation of one device will affect the other.
Label: is connected to

Comment: A relationship that describes a device sending a signal to another device.
Label: sends signal to

Comment: A relationship that describes a device's location.
Label: has geo location

Comment: A relationship that links a measure to a double value.
Label: has numerical value

Comment: A relationship that links a device to a string label.
Label: label

Comment: A relationship that links a state to a string value.
Label: description
